TextView.android:text: Sheet G: TItle Block - Continuous mobile operations Including minor Kerbside Works during periods of Low Risk
This sheet covers predominantly continuous
mobile operations involving only a single
vehicle. This includes brief periodic stops
by vehicle operatives. Works in this category
may omit use of cones and barriers, once
the following criteria are met, and provided
that safe working methods are used.
Is jobsite along the kerb?
Is there good visibility?
Including weather, and obstructions to
to view, junctions.
Is it a period of low risk?
i.e. off-peak, low traffic and
pedestrian volumes etc.
Is works vehicle conspicuously coloured
and are all operatives wearing CLASS
to view, junctions.
Are roof mounted beacons operating?
Is a KEEP LEFT/KEEP RIGHT BLUE ARROW
sign used (as appropriate)?
[Vehicle mounted sign to be covered
when moving.]
For works at junctions, operatives can work
from the footpath, an Advance Warning sign,
and a Blue Arrow sign are placed to warn
traffic on the same side of the road
as the works?
Is there a traffic build-up behind the works
Where traffic congeston is unlikely to occur.
Is works vehicle required to make occasional
Use Sheet 0 to select appropriate
traffic management plan, or refer
to your inspector.
Passive self regulating GIVE and TAKE
traffic management may be used.
Advance Warning Signs are required.
Signs to be placed on all approaches
so they are visible to traffic at least 50
metres away. Works should not take
place more than 1km from these
Complete the works in a safe manner.
